text:
Accusing West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee of playing vote-bank politics by assuring “fool-proof security” to the Pakistan cricket team, Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday said no match must be played till Pakistan stops sponsoring infiltration in India.

He praised Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Virbhadra Singh for showing “true patriotism” over his stand on the match, and accused Ms. Banerjee of using the India-Pakistan WT20 match for vote-bank politics.

“Cricket and bombs can’t go hand in hand,” the Sena chief said adding, “The big question is: should we play with those who attack India. There should be sportsmanship. We are not against the spirit of the game. They will strike twice and we will strike twice. There will be kabaddi matches, cricket matches...It goes on. But, they [Pakistan] aid infiltration.” — PTI
title: ‘Cricket and bombs can’t go hand in hand’
